summary.span: 表示任意大的带符号整数。

span.span: Represents an arbitrarily large signed integer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类型是不可变类型，表示任意大整数的值在理论上没有上限或下限的边界。The type is an immutable type that represents an arbitrarily large integer whose value in theory has no upper or lower bounds. 成员类型几乎其他整数类型 ( ， ， ， ， ， ， ，和类型)。The members of the type closely parallel those of other integral types (the , , , , , , , and types). 此类型不同于其他整数类型在[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]，其中包含所指示的范围其`MinValue`和`MaxValue`属性。This type differs from the other integral types in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], which have a range indicated by their `MinValue` and `MaxValue` properties. > [!NOTE] > 因为类型是不可变 (请参阅[可变性和 BigInteger 结构](#mutability))，因为它有没有上限或下限的边界，可能会导致任何操作引发值太增长大。Because the type is immutable (see [Mutability and the BigInteger Structure](#mutability)) and because it has no upper or lower bounds, an can be thrown for any operation that causes a value to grow too large. ## 实例化 BigInteger 对象Instantiating a BigInteger Object 可以实例化对象有几个方面：You can instantiate a object in several ways: - 你可以使用`new`关键字并提供任何整型或浮点值作为参数传递给构造函数。You can use the `new` keyword and provide any integral or floating-point value as a parameter to the constructor. (浮点值被截断之前分配给。)下面的示例演示如何使用`new`关键字来实例化值。(Floating-point values are truncated before they are assigned to the .) The following example illustrates how to use the `new` keyword to instantiate values. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#1)] - 你可以声明变量，并将分配一个值，就像你那样任何数值类型，只要该值是整数类型。You can declare a variable and assign it a value just as you would any numeric type, as long as that value is an integral type. 下面的示例使用分配创建值从。The following example uses assignment to create a value from an . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#2)] - 你可以分配到一个十进制或浮点值对象，如果将值强制转换的虚拟机或模板，首先将其转换。You can assign a decimal or floating-point value to a object if you cast the value or convert it first. 下面的示例显式强制转换 （在 C# 中) 或 （在 Visual Basic 中) 将转换和值赋给。The following example explicitly casts (in C#) or converts (in Visual Basic) a and a value to a . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#3)] 这些方法使你能够实例化其值处于与一个现有的数值范围的对象类型仅。These methods enable you to instantiate a object whose value is in the range of one of the existing numeric types only. 可以实例化其值可以超过该范围的三种方式之一中的现有数值类型的对象：You can instantiate a object whose value can exceed the range of the existing numeric types in one of three ways: - 你可以使用`new`关键字并提供到任何大小的字节数组构造函数。You can use the `new` keyword and provide a byte array of any size to the constructor. 例如:For example: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#4)] - 你可以调用或方法要转换的字符串表示形式到数值。You can call the or methods to convert the string representation of a number to a . 例如:For example: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#5)] - 你可以调用`static`(`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中)对数值表达式执行某种操作并返回计算方法结果。You can call a `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) method that performs some operation on a numeric expression and returns a calculated result. 下面的示例执行此通过立方并分配到结果。The following example does this by cubing and assigning the result to a . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#6)] 未初始化的值是。The uninitialized value of a is . ## 对 BigInteger 值执行操作Performing Operations on BigInteger Values 你可以使用实例像使用任何其他整数类型。You can use a instance as you would use any other integral type. 重载标准数值的运算符，以使您能够执行基本的数学运算，例如加法、 减法、 除法、 乘法、 减法、 求反和一元求反。 overloads the standard numeric operators to enable you to perform basic mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, subtraction, negation, and unary negation. 你还可以使用标准数值运算符比较两个与每个其他的值。You can also use the standard numeric operators to compare two values with each other. 与其他整数类型，类似还支持的按位`And`， `Or`， `XOr`，左移位和右移位运算符。Like the other integral types, also supports the bitwise `And`, `Or`, `XOr`, left shift, and right shift operators. 不支持自定义运算符的语言结构还提供了用于执行数学运算的等效方法。For languages that do not support custom operators, the structure also provides equivalent methods for performing mathematical operations. 其中包括， ， ， ， ，以及其他几个人。These include , , , , , and several others. 许多成员结构直接对应于其他整数类型的成员。Many members of the structure correspond directly to members of the other integral types. 此外，添加成员，如下所示：In addition, adds members such as the following: - 它返回一个值，指示的符号值。, which returns a value that indicates the sign of a value. - 它返回数值的绝对值值。, which returns the absolute value of a value. - 它返回商和余数的除法运算。, which returns both the quotient and remainder of a division operation. - 它返回最大公约数的两个值。, which returns the greatest common divisor of two values. 很多这些其他成员对应于的成员类，该类提供的功能，可以使用基元数值类型。Many of these additional members correspond to the members of the class, which provides the functionality to work with the primitive numeric types. ## 可变性和 BigInteger 结构Mutability and the BigInteger Structure 下面的示例实例化对象，然后逐个增加其值。The following example instantiates a object and then increments its value by one. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#1)] 尽管此示例看起来可以修改现有对象的值，这不是这种情况。Although this example appears to modify the value of the existing object, this is not the case. 对象是不可变的这意味着内部，公共语言运行时实际创建一个新对象并将其分配一个大于其以前的值的值。 objects are immutable, which means that internally, the common language runtime actually creates a new object and assigns it a value one greater than its previous value. 此新对象然后返回到调用方。This new object is then returned to the caller. > [!NOTE] > .NET Framework 中的其他数值类型也是不可变的。The other numeric types in the .NET Framework are also immutable. 但是，因为类型已没有上限或下限的边界，其值可以变得非常大并对性能产生显著影响。However, because the type has no upper or lower bounds, its values can grow extremely large and have a measurable impact on performance. 尽管此过程是透明的调用方，但它确实会引致性能下降。Although this process is transparent to the caller, it does incur a performance penalty. 在某些情况下，尤其是当重复执行操作在循环中非常大值，该性能损失可能很重要。In some cases, especially when repeated operations are performed in a loop on very large values, that performance penalty can be significant. 例如，在下面的示例中，执行操作重复达数百万次，和一个值就会递增 1 每次该操作成功。For example, in the following example, an operation is performed repetitively up to a million times, and a value is incremented by one every time the operation succeeds. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#12)] 在这种情况下，可以提高性能，通过执行到的所有中间分配变量。In such a case, you can improve performance by performing all intermediate assignments to an variable. 然后，该变量的最终值可以分配给对象循环退出时。The final value of the variable can then be assigned to the object when the loop exits. 下面的示例进行了这方面的演示。The following example provides an illustration. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#3)] ## 使用字节数组和十六进制字符串Working with Byte Arrays and Hexadecimal Strings 如果你转换到字节数组的值或如果你转换到的字节数组值，你必须考虑的字节顺序。If you convert values to byte arrays, or if you convert byte arrays to values, you must consider the order of bytes. 结构要求的各个字节中的字节数组才会显示在 little-endian 的顺序 （即值较低序位字节先于更高序位字节）。The structure expects the individual bytes in a byte array to appear in little-endian order (that is, the lower-order bytes of the value precede the higher-order bytes). 你可以往返值通过调用方法，然后将生成的字节数组到构造函数，如以下示例所示。You can round-trip a value by calling the method and then passing the resulting byte array to the constructor, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#1)] 若要实例化值可以将整数值与传递一个表示某些其他整数类型的值的字节数组，从方法，并生成的字节数组到然后传入构造函数。To instantiate a value from a byte array that represents a value of some other integral type, you can pass the integral value to the method, and then pass the resulting byte array to the constructor. 下面的示例实例化值从一个字节数组，表示值。The following example instantiates a value from a byte array that represents an value. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#2)] 结构假定，使用 2 的补数表示存储负值。The structure assumes that negative values are stored by using two's complement representation. 因为结构表示具有无固定长度的数字值构造函数始终解释为符号位数组中的最后一个字节的最高有效位。Because the structure represents a numeric value with no fixed length, the constructor always interprets the most significant bit of the last byte in the array as a sign bit. 若要防止从令人费解 2 的补数表示形式的负值正是正数值的符号和量值表示的构造函数在其中最大值的字节数组中的最后一个字节的有效位通常为集应包含额外的字节，其值为 0。To prevent the constructor from confusing the two's complement representation of a negative value with the sign and magnitude representation of a positive value, positive values in which the most significant bit of the last byte in the byte array would ordinarily be set should include an additional byte whose value is 0. 例如，0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 是小 endian 十六进制表示形式 1000000 或 4293967296。For example, 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF is the little-endian hexadecimal representation of either -1,000,000 or 4,293,967,296. 因为此数组中的最后一个字节的最高有效位是打开的字节数组的值将被为-1000000 的构造函数。Because the most significant bit of the last byte in this array is on, the value of the byte array would be interpreted by the constructor as -1,000,000. 若要实例化其值为正，字节数组，其元素为 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 0x00 必须传递给构造函数。To instantiate a whose value is positive, a byte array whose elements are 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 0x00 must be passed to the constructor. 下面的示例阐释了这一点。The following example illustrates this. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#3)] 字节数组创建从正值的方法包括此额外的零值字节。Byte arrays created by the method from positive values include this extra zero-value byte. 因此，结构可以成功往返行程值通过分配给，然后将它们还原从字节数组，如以下示例所示。Therefore, the structure can successfully round-trip values by assigning them to, and then restoring them from, byte arrays, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#4)] 但是，你可能需要将此额外的零值字节添加到动态创建的开发人员或通过将无符号的整数转换为字节数组的方法返回的字节数组 (如， ，和)。However, you may need to add this additional zero-value byte to byte arrays that are created dynamically by the developer or that are returned by methods that convert unsigned integers to byte arrays (such as , , and ). 在分析十六进制字符串时和方法假定，如果设置字符串中的第一个字节的最高有效位，或如果字符串的第一个十六进制数字表示较低的四位的字节值，则值为通过使用 2 的补数表示形式表示。When parsing a hexadecimal string, the and methods assume that if the most significant bit of the first byte in the string is set, or if the first hexadecimal digit of the string represents the lower four bits of a byte value, the value is represented by using two's complement representation. 例如，"FF01"和"F01"表示的十进制值-255。For example, both "FF01" and "F01" represent the decimal value -255. 若要区分正负值，正值应包括前导零。To differentiate positive from negative values, positive values should include a leading zero. 相关重载方法，在传递"X"格式字符串时, 添加到正值返回的十六进制字符串前导零。The relevant overloads of the method, when they are passed the "X" format string, add a leading zero to the returned hexadecimal string for positive values. 这样便能保存/还原值使用和方法，如以下示例所示。This makes it possible to round-trip values by using the and methods, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#5)] 但是，通过调用创建的十六进制字符串`ToString`其他整数类型或的重载的方法方法包括`toBase`参数不会指示的值或从其源数据类型的符号派生的十六进制字符串。However, the hexadecimal strings created by calling the `ToString` methods of the other integral types or the overloads of the method that include a `toBase` parameter do not indicate the sign of the value or the source data type from which the hexadecimal string was derived. 已成功实例化从这样的字符串值需要一些其他的逻辑。Successfully instantiating a value from such a string requires some additional logic. 下面的示例提供了一种可能实现。The following example provides one possible implementation. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples2.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples2.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 中的单个字节`value`数组应采用 little-endian 的顺序，从最低位字节到高序位字节。The individual bytes in the `value` array should be in little-endian order, from lowest-order byte to highest-order byte. 例如，数值 1000000000000 由下表中所示：For example, the numeric value 1,000,000,000,000 is represented as shown in the following table: ||| |-|-| |十六进制字符串Hexadecimal string|E8D4A51000E8D4A51000| |字节数组 （首先最低索引）Byte array (lowest index first)|00 10 A5 D4 E8 0000 10 A5 D4 E8 00| 将数值转换为字节数组，如的大多数方法和，在 little-endian 的顺序返回字节数组。Most methods that convert numeric values to byte arrays, such as and , return byte arrays in little-endian order. 构造函数需要在要使用符号数值表示法，并且负值使用 2 的补数表示的字节数组中的正值。The constructor expects positive values in the byte array to use sign-and-magnitude representation, and negative values to use two's complement representation. 换而言之，如果最高顺序位中的最高序位字节的`value`设置，则结果值为负。In other words, if the highest-order bit of the highest-order byte in `value` is set, the resulting value is negative. 具体取决于的字节数组的源，这可能导致被错误解释为一个负值是正数值。Depending on the source of the byte array, this may cause a positive value to be misinterpreted as a negative value. 字节数组通常通过以下方式生成：Byte arrays are typically generated in the following ways: - 通过调用方法。By calling the method. 因为此方法对于正值的零到返回数组集中的具有最高序位字节的最高顺序位的字节数组，则不可能的错误解释为负值是正数值。Because this method returns a byte array with the highest-order bit of the highest-order byte in the array set to zero for positive values, there is no chance of misinterpreting a positive value as negative. 修改字节数组创建方法总是能成功往返传递给构造函数。Unmodified byte arrays created by the method always successfully round-trip when they are passed to the constructor. - 通过调用方法并将其作为参数传递一个带符号的整数。By calling the method and passing it a signed integer as a parameter. 有符号的整数处理符号数值表示法和 2 的补数表示，因为没有为负值正值可能。Because signed integers handle both sign-and-magnitude representation and two's complement representation, there is no chance of misinterpreting a positive value as negative. - 通过调用方法并将其作为参数传递的无符号的整数。By calling the method and passing it an unsigned integer as a parameter. 无符号的整数表示由它们的量仅，因为正值可能被曲解为负值。Because unsigned integers are represented by their magnitude only, positive values can be misinterpreted as negative values. 若要防止此错误解释，可以向数组的末尾添加一个零字节值。To prevent this misinterpretation, you can add a zero-byte value to the end of the array. 下一节中的示例所示。The example in the next section provides an illustration. - 通过创建一个字节数组可以动态或静态而不一定调用任何之前的方法，或通过修改现有的字节数组。By creating a byte array either dynamically or statically without necessarily calling any of the previous methods, or by modifying an existing byte array. 若要防止正值被错误解释为负值，可以向数组的末尾添加一个零字节值。To prevent positive values from being misinterpreted as negative values, you can add a zero-byte value to the end of the array. 如果`value`是一个空数组，则新对象初始化为值为。If `value` is an empty array, the new object is initialized to a value of . 如果`value`是`null`，在构造函数引发。If `value` is `null`, the constructor throws an . ## Examples 下面的示例实例化从 5 元素字节数组，其值是 {5，4，3，2，1} 的对象。The following example instantiates a object from a 5-element byte array whose value is {5, 4, 3, 2, 1}. 然后，它显示值，表示为十进制和十六进制数字，到控制台。It then displays the value, represented as both decimal and hexadecimal numbers, to the console. 文本输出的输入数组的比较可以清楚为什么的此重载类构造函数创建对象，其值是 4328719365 （或 0x102030405）。A comparison of the input array with the text output makes it clear why this overload of the class constructor creates a object whose value is 4328719365 (or 0x102030405). 字节数组，其值为 5，第一个元素定义的值的最低序位字节对象，它是 0x05。The first element of the byte array, whose value is 5, defines the value of the lowest-order byte of the object, which is 0x05. 字节数组，其值为 4，第二个元素定义的第二个字节的值对象，它是 0x04，依次类推。The second element of the byte array, whose value is 4, defines the value of the second byte of the object, which is 0x04, and so on. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#1)] 下面的示例实例化一个正数和负数值时，请将它们传递到方法，然后将还原原始生成的字节数组中的值。The following example instantiates a positive and a negative value, passes them to the method, and then restores the original values from the resulting byte array. 请注意两个值由相同的字节数组。Note that the two values are represented by identical byte arrays. 它们之间的唯一区别是中的字节数组中的最后一个元素的最高有效位。The only difference between them is in the most significant bit of the last element in the byte array. 此位是设置 （的字节的值为 0xFF），如果数组创建从负值。This bit is set (the value of the byte is 0xFF) if the array is created from a negative value. 位未设置 （的字节的值为零），如果数组创建一个正从值。The bit is not set (the value of the byte is zero), if the array is created from a positive value. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#2)] 下面的示例演示如何确保，是正数值不正确实例化为一个负值加上其值为 0 到数组末尾的字节。The following example illustrates how to make sure that a positive value is not incorrectly instantiated as a negative value by adding a byte whose value is zero to the end of the array. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 最大公约数是到其中的最大数目两个值可以划分而无需返回余数。The greatest common divisor is the largest number into which the two values can be divided without returning a remainder. 如果`left`和`right`参数均为非零数字，因为所有数字都除 1 后，该方法将始终返回至少值为 1。If the `left` and `right` parameters are non-zero numbers, the method always returns at least a value of 1 because all numbers can be divided by 1. 如果任一参数为零，该方法将返回非零参数的绝对值的数值。If either parameter is zero, the method returns the absolute value of the non-zero parameter. 如果这两个值均为零，则该方法返回零。If both values are zero, the method returns zero. > [!NOTE] > 计算最大公约数非常大的值的`left`和`right`可以是非常耗时的操作。Computing the greatest common divisor of very large values of `left` and `right` can be a very time-consuming operation. 返回的值方法始终为正的符号无论`left`和`right`参数。The value returned by the method is always positive regardless of the sign of the `left` and `right` parameters. ## Examples 下面的示例演示调用方法和异常处理提供了一些有用的信息所需。The following example illustrates a call to the method and the exception handling necessary to provide useful information about an . 结果指示最大公约数的这两个数字为 1。The result indicates that the greatest common divisor of these two numbers is 1. remarks.format: ## Remarks 会为不支持运算符重载的语言实现方法。The method is implemented for languages that do not support operator overloading. 其行为等同于使用乘法运算符的乘法。Its behavior is identical to multiplication using the multiplication operator. 此外，方法是乘法运算符的有用替代方案，在实例化时变量中将其分配的产品的乘法，得到的结果，如下面的示例中所示。In addition, the method is a useful substitute for the multiplication operator when instantiating a variable by assigning it a product that results from multiplication, as shown in the following example. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/cs/Multiply1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/vb/Multiply1.vb#1)] 如果有必要，此方法会自动执行到其他整数类型的隐式转换对象。If necessary, this method automatically performs implicit conversion of other integral types to objects. 在下一节中的示例阐释了这其中方法传递两个值。This is illustrated in the example in the next section, where the method is passed two values. ## Examples 下面的示例尝试执行乘法的两个长整型。The following example tries to perform multiplication with two long integers. 因为的结果超出了长整数范围引发，与调用方法来处理乘法。Because the result exceeds the range of a long integer, an is thrown, and the method is called to handle the multiplication. 请注意，C# 需要您使用两个`checked`（如此示例所示） 的关键字或`/checked+`编译器选项，以确保数字溢出引发异常。Note that C# requires that you use either the `checked` keyword (as in this example) or the `/checked+` compiler option to make sure an exception is thrown on a numeric overflow. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 按位异的结果`Or`操作`true`如果两位的值不同; 否则为它是`false`。The result of a bitwise exclusive `Or` operation is `true` if the values of the two bits are different; otherwise, it is `false`. 下表说明了独占`Or`操作。The following table illustrates the exclusive `Or` operation. |中的位 x `left`Bit x in `left`|中的位 x `right`Bit x in `right`|返回值Return value| |---------------------|----------------------|------------------| |00|00|00| |00|11|11| |11|00|11| |11|11|00| 方法使代码如下所示：The method enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/cs/Operator1.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/vb/Operator1.vb#8)] 方法执行按位异`Or`对两个操作值就像它们是采用二者带虚拟符号扩展的补数表示形式。The method performs the bitwise exclusive `Or` operation on two values as if they were both in two's complement representation with virtual sign extension.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 任何小数部分`value`参数被截断转换前。Any fractional part of the `value` parameter is truncated before conversion. 重载方法定义的类型到其中或从中可将对象转换。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 因为从转换到可能涉及截断任何小数部分`value`，语言编译器不会自动执行此转换。Because the conversion from to can involve truncating any fractional part of `value`, language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically. 相反，它们执行转换仅当 （在 C# 中) 强制转换运算符或转换函数 (如`CType`在 Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` in Visual Basic) is used. 否则，它们显示编译器错误。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 对于不支持自定义运算符的语言，替代方法是。For languages that do not support custom operators, the alternative method is . ## Examples 以下示例将转换的数组中的各个元素值复制到对象，，然后显示每个转换的结果。The following example converts the individual elements in an array of values to objects, and then displays the result of each conversion. 请注意对任何小数部分的一部分在转换期间截断值。Note that any fractional part of a value is truncated during the conversion. remarks.format: ## Remarks 重载方法定义的类型到其中或从中可将对象转换。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 语言编译器不会自动执行此转换，因为它会导致数据丢失或精度损失。Language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically because it can involve data loss or a loss of precision. 相反，它们执行转换仅当 （在 C# 中) 强制转换运算符或转换函数 (如`CType`或`CSng`在 Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` or `CSng` in Visual Basic) is used. 否则，它们显示编译器错误。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 因为值可以是外部的范围数据类型，此操作都是收缩转换。Because the value can be outside the range of the data type, this operation is a narrowing conversion. 如果转换失败，它不会引发。If the conversion is unsuccessful, it does not throw an . 相反，如果值是小于，生成值是。Instead, if the value is less than , the resulting value is . 如果值是否大于，生成值是。If the value is greater than , the resulting value is . 转换到可能会丢失精度。The conversion of a to a may involve a loss of precision. 在某些情况下，精度损失可能会导致成功执行该强制转换或转换操作即使值的范围超出了数据类型。In some cases, the loss of precision may cause the casting or conversion operation to succeed even if the value is outside the range of the data type. 下面的示例进行了这方面的演示。The following example provides an illustration. 它将分配的最大值到两个变量，将一个变量通过 9.999 e 291,，并测试两个变量是否相等。It assigns the maximum value of a to two variables, increments one variable by 9.999e291, and tests the two variables for equality. 按预期对的调用方式方法演示，它们不相等。As expected, the call to the method shows that they are unequal. 但是，将较大的转换该值转换回成功，尽管值现在超出。However, the conversion of the larger value back to a succeeds, although the value now exceeds . remarks.format: ## Remarks 任何小数部分`value`参数被截断转换前。Any fractional part of the `value` parameter is truncated before conversion. 对于不支持隐式运算符的语言，替代方法是。For languages that do not support implicit operators, the alternative method is . 重载方法定义的类型，或从其编译器可自动转换到而无需使用显式强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或调用转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中) 的值。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a compiler can automatically convert a value without an explicit casting operator (in C#) or a call to a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 它们扩大转换，不会丢失数据，不会引发。They are widening conversions that do not involve data loss and do not throw an . 此重载使编译器能够处理从转换值赋给值，如以下示例所示。This overload lets the compiler handle conversions from a value to a value, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Implicit#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Implicit/cs/Implicit1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Implicit#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Implicit/vb/Implicit1.vb#1)]

[!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#25](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#25)] 因为对象是不可变，运算符创建一个新对象，其值是一个多个所表示的对象`value`。Because objects are immutable, the operator creates a new object whose value is one more than the object represented by `value`. 因此，重复调用可能成本很高。Therefore, repeated calls to may be expensive. 此运算符的等效方法是。The equivalent method for this operator is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定义的操作的按位反码运算符的值。The method defines the operation of the bitwise one's complement operator for values. 每位中的数字值的按位反码运算符反转。The bitwise one's complement operator reverses each bit in a numeric value. 即，位`value`都 0 将设置为 1 在结果中，并为 1 的位将设置为在结果为 0。That is, bits in `value` that are 0 are set to 1 in the result, and bits that are 1 are set to 0 in the result. 方法使代码如下所示：The method enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OnesComplement#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OnesComplement/cs/OnesComplement1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OnesComplement#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OnesComplement/vb/OnesComplement1.vb#1)] 不支持自定义运算符的语言可以在调用方法直接以执行按位二进制反码运算。Languages that do not support custom operators may be able to call the method directly to perform a bitwise one's complement operation. 例如:For example: [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OnesComplement#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OnesComplement/vb/onescomplement2.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定义的按位右移运算符的运算值。The method defines the operation of the bitwise right-shift operator for values. 它使代码如下所示：It enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#47](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/cs/RightShift1.cs#47)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#47](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/vb/Operator1.vb#47)] 不支持自定义运算符的语言可以执行按位右移运算除以`value`通过`BigInteger.Pow(2, shift)`和减去 1 次`shift`负值。Languages that do not support custom operators can perform a bitwise right-shift operation by dividing `value` by `BigInteger.Pow(2, shift)` and subtracting 1 times `shift` for negative values. 下面的示例演示的结果与使用此运算符的结果相同。The following example shows that the results are identical to the results of using this operator. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#48](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/cs/RightShift1.cs#48)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#48](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/vb/Operator1.vb#48)] 如果`shift`大于或等于正比特数值，右移运算的结果是。If `shift` is greater than or equal to the number of bits in a positive value, the result of the right-shift operation is . 如果`shift`大于在负的比特数值，右移运算的结果是。If `shift` is greater than the number of bits in a negative value, the result of the right-shift operation is .

[*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 有效的符号字符由和当前区域性的属性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 忽略任何前导零。Any leading zeros are ignored.| > [!NOTE] > 指定的字符串`value`参数解释使用样式。The string specified by the `value` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 不能包含任何组分隔符或小数分隔符，并且它不能具有小数部分。It cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `value`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数初始化针对当前系统区域性的对象。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 若要通过使用特定区域性的格式设置信息中分析字符串，使用方法。To parse a string by using the formatting information of a specific culture, use the method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果你使用保存/还原的字符串表示的方法的已输出的值方法，则应使用使用"R"格式说明符生成的字符串表示形式的方法值。If you use the method to round-trip the string representation of a value that was output by the method, you should use the method with the "R" format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否则为的字符串表示形式仅 50，最高有效位的原始值和数据可能会丢失，当你使用保留方法，使还原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法可实例化两个对象。The following example uses the method to instantiate two objects. 它将乘以每个对象由另一个数，然后调用方法来确定两个值之间的关系。It multiplies each object by another number and then calls the method to determine the relationship between the two values. separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `value` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `styles` 必须是中的位标志的组合枚举。`styles` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`参数将使得此方法重载有用`value`时数字系统 （十进制或十六进制） 由包含的字符串表示形式的十六进制值，`value`仅在运行时，已知时，或者当你想要禁止的空白区域或正负符号`value`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `value` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `value` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `value`. 根据值`style`、`value`参数可能包括以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `value` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 如果`style`包括、`value`参数可能包含下列元素：If `style` includes , the `value` parameter may contain the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space. 空格可以出现在开始`value`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`value`如果`style`包括标志。White space can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定于区域性的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字符串中的位置由和当前区域性的属性。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the current culture. 当前区域性的货币符号可以出现在`value`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 符号可以出现在开始`value`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`value`如果`style`包括标志。The sign can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag. 可以在使用括号`value`以指示负值，如果`style`包括标志。Parentheses can be used in `value` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*

*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*

*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|一系列从 0 到 9 的数字。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. 有关*fractional_digits*，但只数字 0 有效。For *fractional_digits*, only the digit 0 is valid.| 可以显示为分析操作才能成功; 一个小数数字如果*fractional_digits*包括任何其他数字引发。Only the digit 0 can appear as a fractional digit for the parse operation to succeed; if *fractional_digits* includes any other digit, a is thrown.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字符，指示该值表示指数 （科学型） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `value`参数可以表示指数记数法的数字，如果`style`包括标志。The `value` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|一系列从 0 到 f 或从 0 到 F.的十六进制数字A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 仅为数字的字符串 (它对应于样式) 总是可以分析成功。A string with digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 其余的大多数成员控件可能会存在，但不是需要为存在于输入字符串中的元素。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in the input string. 下表指示个别成员影响中可能存在的元素`value`。The following table indicates how individual members affect the elements that may be present in `value`. |`NumberStyles` 值`NumberStyles` value|元素允许在`value`除数字之外Elements permitted in `value` in addition to digits| elements.| ||"E"或"E"字符，它指示指数记数法，连同*exponential_digits*。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates exponential notation, along with *exponential_digits*.| ||*Ws*起始处的元素`value`。The *ws* element at the number.| > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果你使用保存/还原的字符串表示的方法的已输出的值方法，则应使用使用"R"格式说明符生成的字符串表示形式的方法值。If you use the method to round-trip the string representation of a value that was output by the method, you should only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. 与其他不同值，该值允许，但不是需要，特定样式中的元素是否存在`value`、样式值意味着中的单个数字字符`value`总是被解释为十六进制字符。Unlike the other values, which allow for, but do not require, the presence of particular style elements in `value`, the style value means that the individual numeric characters in `value` are always interpreted as hexadecimal characters. 有效的十六进制字符为 0-9、 A-F 和 a-f。Valid hexadecimal characters are 0-9, A-F, and a-f. 其他标志只有可以与组合`style`参数和。The only other flags that can be combined with the `style` parameter are and . (枚举包含复合数字样式， ，其中包含两个空白标志。)(The enumeration includes a composite number style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`value`是的字符串表示的十六进制数，则无法将前面添加的任何修饰符 (如`0x`或`&h`) 用于将其识别为十六进制数。If `value` is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 这将导致转换失败。This causes the conversion to fail. 如果`value`是一个十六进制的字符串，方法将解释`value`作为使用 2 的补数表示，其前两个十六进制数字是否大于或等于存储的负数`0x80`。If `value` is a hexadecimal string, the method interprets `value` as a negative number stored by using two's complement representation if its first two hexadecimal digits are greater than or equal to `0x80`. 换而言之，此方法将解释中的第一个字节的最高顺序位`value`用作符号位。In other words, the method interprets the highest-order bit of the first byte in `value` as the sign bit. 若要确保十六进制字符串正确地解释为正数中的第一个数字`value`必须具有值为零。To make sure that a hexadecimal string is correctly interpreted as a positive number, the first digit in `value` must have a value of zero. 例如，此方法将解释`0x80`为负值，但它解释`0x080`或`0x0080`为正值。For example, the method interprets `0x80` as a negative value, but it interprets either `0x080` or `0x0080` as a positive value. 下面的示例演示了表示正负值的十六进制字符串之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between hexadecimal strings that represent negative and positive values. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/cs/ParseHex1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/vb/ParseHex1.vb#3)] `value`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数初始化针对当前系统区域性的对象。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 若要指定分析操作使用其格式设置信息的区域性，调用重载。To specify the culture whose formatting information is used for the parse operation, call the overload. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何调用具有几个可能值的方法`style`参数。The following example illustrates calls to the method with several possible values for the `style` parameter. 它阐释了如何将字符串解释为十六进制值，以及如何禁止空格和正负符号。It illustrates how to interpret a string as a hexadecimal value, and how to disallow spaces and sign symbols. separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `value` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `styles` 必须是中的位标志的组合枚举。`styles` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`参数将使得此方法重载有用`value`时数字系统 （十进制或十六进制） 由包含的字符串表示形式的十六进制值，`value`仅在运行时，已知时，或者当你想要禁止的空白区域或正负符号`value`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `value` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `value` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `value`. 根据值`style`、`value`参数可能包括以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `value` parameter may include the following elements: brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space. 空格可以出现在开始`value`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`value`如果`style`包括标志。White space can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定于区域性的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字符串中的位置由和区域性属性由`provider`参数。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the culture indicated by the `provider` parameter. 当前区域性的货币符号可以出现在`value`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. if `style` includes the flag.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 指定的区域性的小数点符号`provider`可以出现在`value`如果`style`包括标志。The decimal point symbol of the culture designated by format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否则为的字符串表示形式仅 50，最高有效位的原始值和数据可能会丢失，当你使用保留方法，使还原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. 与其他不同值，从而允许但不是需要特定样式中的元素是否存在`value`、样式值意味着中的单个数字字符`value`总是被解释为十六进制字符。Unlike the other values, which allow for but do not require the presence of particular style elements in `value`, the style value means that the individual numeric characters in `value` are always interpreted as hexadecimal characters. 有效的十六进制字符为 0-9、 A-F 和 a-f。Valid hexadecimal characters are 0-9, A-F, and a-f. 其他标志只有可以与组合`style`参数和。The only other flags that can be combined with the `style` parameter are and . (枚举包含复合数字样式， ，其中包含两个空白标志。)(The enumeration includes a composite number style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`value`是的字符串表示的十六进制数，则无法将前面添加的任何修饰符 (如`0x`或`&h`) 用于将其识别为十六进制数。If `value` is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 这将导致转换失败。This causes the conversion to fail. 如果`value`是一个十六进制的字符串，方法将解释`value`作为使用 2 的补数表示，其前两个十六进制数字是否大于或等于存储的负数`0x80`。If `value` is a hexadecimal string, the method interprets `value` as a negative number stored by using two's complement representation if its first two hexadecimal digits are greater than or equal to `0x80`. 换而言之，此方法将解释中的第一个字节的最高顺序位`value`用作符号位。In other words, the method interprets the highest-order bit of the first byte in `value` as the sign bit. 若要确保十六进制字符串正确地解释为正数中的第一个数字`value`必须具有值为零。To make sure that a hexadecimal string is correctly interpreted as a positive number, the first digit in `value` must have a value of zero. 例如，此方法将解释`0x80`为负值，但它解释`0x080`或`0x0080`为正值。For example, the method interprets `0x80` as a negative value, but it interprets either `0x080` or `0x0080` as a positive value. 下面的示例演示了表示正负值的十六进制字符串之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between hexadecimal strings that represent negative and positive values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回的数组中的各个字节出现在 little-endian 的顺序。The individual bytes in the array returned by this method appear in little-endian order. 也就是说，值较低序位字节先于更高序位字节。That is, the lower-order bytes of the value precede the higher-order bytes. 数组的第一个字节反映前八位值，第二个字节反映了下一步的八位，依次类推。The first byte of the array reflects the first eight bits of the value, the second byte reflects the next eight bits, and so on. 例如，值 1024 或 0x0400 存储为以下两个字节的数组：For example, the value 1024, or 0x0400, is stored as the following array of two bytes: |元素Element|字节值Byte value| |-------------|----------------| |00|0x000x00| |11|0x040x04| 负值写入到数组中的最精简的窗体可能使用 2 的补数表示。Negative values are written to the array using two's complement representation in the most compact form possible. 例如，-1 表示为一个字节，其值是`0xFF`而不是作为数组与多个元素，如`0xFF`，`0xFF`或`0xFF`， `0xFF`， `0xFF`， `0xFF`。For example, -1 is represented as a single byte whose value is `0xFF` instead of as an array with multiple elements, such as `0xFF`, `0xFF` or `0xFF`, `0xFF`, `0xFF`, `0xFF`. 因为 2 的补数表示形式始终解释数组中的最后一个字节的最高顺序位 (处位置的字节 `- 1`) 用作符号位，该方法返回具有额外的元素，其值为零的字节数组到消除歧义否则无法解释为具有设置其符号位的正值。Because two's complement representation always interprets the highest-order bit of the last byte in the array (the byte at position `- 1`) as the sign bit, the method returns a byte array with an extra element whose value is zero to disambiguate positive values that could otherwise be interpreted as having their sign bits set. 例如，值 120 或`0x78`表示为单字节的数组： `0x78`。For example, the value 120 or `0x78` is represented as a single-byte array: `0x78`. 但是，128 或`0x80`，表示为两个字节的数组： `0x80`， `0x00`。However, 128, or `0x80`, is represented as a two-byte array: `0x80`, `0x00`. 你可以往返值将它存储为字节数组，然后将其使用还原构造函数。You can round-trip a value by storing it to a byte array and then restoring it using the constructor. > [!CAUTION] > 如果你的代码修改它还原的值之前，此方法返回的数组内的单个字节值，则必须确保不要无意中更改符号位。If your code modifies the value of individual bytes in the array returned by this method before it restores the value, you must make sure that you do not unintentionally change the sign bit. 例如，如果您的修改，以便最高顺序位的字节数组的最后一个元素中增加是正数值成为集，则可以添加其值为 0 到数组末尾的新字节。For example, if your modifications increase a positive value so that the highest-order bit in the last element of the byte array becomes set, you can add a new byte whose value is zero to the end of the array. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何某些值以字节数组表示。The following example illustrates how some values are represented in byte arrays. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray/cs/ToByteArray1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray/vb/ToByteArray1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式"R"或往返，当前区域性的格式中的值。The method formats a value in the "R", or round-trip, format of the current culture. 如果你想要指定其他文件格式或区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| 字符串表示形式值包括一个负号，如果其值为负数，且一系列的范围从 0 到 9，不带前导零的数字。The string representation of the value includes a negative sign if its value is negative, and a sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9 without leading zeros. 负号由为当前区域性的对象。The negative sign is defined by the object for the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例显示通过使用默认值方法。The following example displays a value by using the default method. 它还显示的字符串表示形式通过使用某些标准格式说明符得到的值。It also displays the string representations of the value that results from using some standard format specifiers. 示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定来显示。The examples are displayed using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式中通过使用指定的格式值对象，表示当前区域性的约定。The method formats a value in a specified format by using a object that represents the conventions of the current culture. 如果你想要使用"R"或往返，格式或指定不同的区域性，请使用其他重载的方法，如下所示：If you want to use the "R", or round-trip, format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `format`参数可以是任何有效[标准数字字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或的任意组合[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [custom numeric format strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等同于或`null`，当前的返回值对象使用往返过程格式说明符 ("R") 进行格式化。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the round-trip format specifier ("R"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关.NET Framework 中的格式设置支持的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 返回字符串的格式由为当前区域性的对象。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 具体取决于`format`参数，此对象控制输出字符串中的负号、 组分隔符和小数点符号等符号。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the negative sign, the group separator, and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供区域性而非当前区域性的格式设置信息，请调用重载。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下面的示例初始化值并将其显示通过使用每个标准格式字符串和某些自定义格式字符串。The following example initializes a value and displays it by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. 你可以将传递表示的区域性的提供格式设置信息的对象。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法返回提供该区域性的数字格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - (其实现仅返回它自身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 你可以传递的自定义对象，实现。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法实例化，并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`，返回字符串的格式设置将基于当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of the returned string is based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例初始化值，并将其显示到控制台中使用标准格式字符串和波形符 （~） 定义为负号的对象。The following example initializes a value, and displays it to the console using a standard format string and a object that defines the tilde (~) as a negative sign. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 此方法无需使用异常处理来测试是否如果`value`无效，无法成功分析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `value` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `value`参数应为以下形式的十进制数字的字符串表示：The `value` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 有效的符号字符由和当前区域性的属性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的十进制数字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| > [!NOTE] > 指定的字符串`value`参数不能包含任何组分隔符或小数分隔符，并且它不能具有小数部分。The string specified by the `value` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `value`参数解释使用样式。The `value` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 十进制数字，除了允许仅前导空格和尾随空格带有前导符号。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要显式定义可出现在的区域性特定格式设置信息的样式元素`value`，调用方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `value`, call the method. `value`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数为当前区域性的对象。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object for the current culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 此重载将解释中的所有位`value`为十进制数字的参数。This overload interprets all digits in the `value` parameter as decimal digits. 若要分析的字符串表示形式的十六进制数，请调用重载。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法可实例化两个对象。The following example uses the method to instantiate two objects. 如果转换成功，它将乘以每个对象由另一个数，然后调用方法来确定两个对象之间的关系。If the conversions succeed, it multiplies each object by another number and then calls the method to determine the relationship between the two objects. you should use the method with the "R" format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否则为的字符串表示形式仅 50，最高有效位的原始值和数据可能会丢失，当你使用保留方法，使还原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. 如果使用标志，`value`必须是十六进制值。If the flag is used, `value` must be a (枚举具有复合样式， ，其中包含两个空白标志。)(The enumeration has a composite style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`value`是的字符串表示的十六进制数，则无法将前面添加的任何修饰符 (如`0x`或`&h`) 用于将其识别为十六进制数。If `value` is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 这将导致转换失败。This causes the conversion to fail. 如果`value`是一个十六进制的字符串，方法将解释`value`作为使用 2 的补数表示，其前两个十六进制数字是否大于或等于存储的负数`0x80`。If `value` is a hexadecimal string, the method interprets `value` as a negative number stored by using two's complement representation if its first two hexadecimal digits are greater than or equal to `0x80`. 换而言之，此方法将解释中的第一个字节的最高顺序位`value`用作符号位。In other words, the method interprets the highest-order bit of the first byte in `value` as the sign bit. 若要确保十六进制字符串正确地解释为正数中的第一个数字`value`必须具有值为零。To make sure that a hexadecimal string is correctly interpreted as a positive number, the first digit in `value` must have a value of zero. 例如，此方法将解释`0x80`为负值，但它解释`0x080`或`0x0080`为正值。For example, the method interprets `0x80` as a negative value, but it interprets either `0x080` or `0x0080` as a positive value. 下面的示例演示了表示正负值的十六进制字符串之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between hexadecimal strings that represent negative and positive values. (其实现仅返回它自身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 实现一个自定义对象。A custom object that implements . 其方法实例化，并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、对象使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例调用某些方法使用的值的各种组合`style`和`provider`参数。The following example makes some calls to the method using various combinations of values for the `style` and `provider` parameters. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回的对象提供方便的来源的零值在赋值和比较中使用。The object returned by this property provides a convenient source of a zero value for use in assignments and comparisons.
